item.title: Answering Causal Queries About Singular Cases
Explanations in Causal Chains - Selecting Distal Causes Requires Exportable Mechanisms
Mediators or alternative explanations - Transitivity in human-mediated causal chains

item.description: I am a post-doctoral researcher at the University of GÃ¶ttingen, working in Michael Waldmann’s Lab of Cognition and Decision Sciences. I’m particularly interested in studying human causal learning and reasoning. Given that causal relationships are neither directly observable nor logically deducible, how do reasoners manage to learn about causes and effect so successfully? How do they use this knowledge to make predictions, diagnoses, or to explain?
